page.title: 06RELIGION
page.content: The Church in Dagnall.There has been a chapel where people could worship for many years although the original Methodist chapel was pulled down when it became unsafe.The present priest has lived in the village for nearly 60 years and has been preaching there for over 40 years.There are 4 Sunday School classes every week, a Sunday morning worship and Holy Communion every Sunday and Wednesday evening.The average congregation is between 70 and 80, and 3 or 4 children are Christened every year.The chapel is the only place of worship in Dagnall although some people in the village travel to Edlesborough\Eaton Bray to attend services there. The priest in Dagnall has the title:Sunday School Superintendant.
